Without guns, people might rely more on non-violent methods of conflict resolution, such as talking things out or using martial arts.
The absence of guns could lead to a shift in the way people perceive and react to threats, potentially making them more cautious and less aggressive.
The removal of guns could lead to a decrease in the number of accidental injuries and deaths, as guns can be dangerous if not handled properly.
The absence of guns might cause a shift in the way people protect themselves and their property, potentially leading to more reliance on non-lethal deterrents such as pepper spray or tasers.
The sudden disappearance of guns could lead to a cultural shift, as guns have long been a symbol of power and status in many societies.
